pullRequest.body:
Given a locally finite linearly ordered set `Γ` and a function `f` on `Γ` whose support is bounded below, we produce a Hahn series whose coefficients are given by `f`.  We introduce a theorem (borrowing from mathlib3 #18604) for translating the vanishing condition to the partially well-ordered support condition that is used in the definition of Hahn Series.

---

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
I may be mistaken, but I think the value group of multivariate Laurent series like `K((X))((Y))` is a lex product of integers, which is not locally finite.  To construct multivariate Laurent series, perhaps combining the results of this PR with #10781 would be fruitful.

Edit: I think I may have misinterpreted your message.  I will rewrite these results to work with locally finite orders.

Edit 2: I have moved the results to `RingTheory/HahnSeries/Basic.lean`.

Thanks!
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Hey! Thanks for adding the content of https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib/pull/18604. In the future, could you give some pointers on the original PR/tell me directly? I had no idea that this PR added my lemmas to mathlib and I was about to port https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib/pull/18604.
@YaelDillies I'm really sorry about that.  I'll let you know if this happens in the future.
No trouble! I really don't mind people PRing my code, but I do want to track when that happens, so as to avoid duplicating work.

This work looks good!

All of these results will still hold for Hahn series whose value group has a locally finite order. It would be good to try generalizing to that level to cover multivariate Laurent series also. If that doesn't work for some reason, I am still willing to approve this PR.

This work looks good!

All of these results will still hold for Hahn series whose value group has a locally finite order. It would be good to try generalizing to that level to cover multivariate Laurent series also. If that doesn't work for some reason, I am still willing to approve this PR.
I suppose this is referring to a mathlib3 PR?
Yes, that's right.

```suggestion
    LaurentSeries R where
  coeff := f
  isPwo_support' := supp_bdd_below_supp_Pwo f n hn
```

```suggestion
```
Please merge `master`, then fix lower/upper cases: `IsPwo` was renamed to `IsPWO` and `IsWf` to `IsWF`. Also, do we have a generic `BddBelow.isPWO`?
I put `Set.bddBelow_wellFoundedOn_lt` in `Mathlib.Order.WellFoundedSet`.  This can be combined with `Set.isWF_iff_isPWO`.

Make it a `dsimp` lemma:
```suggestion
    coeff (LaurentFromSuppBddBelow f n hn) m = f m := rfl
```
BTW, does `@[simps]` on the previous definition work?
I'm not sure how to find that out, but I will investigate.
You can put `@[simps?]` on the definition, then it'll show generated lemmas in a message. If you're happy with these lemmas, then you can remove the question mark and this lemma.
Wow, that is like magic.  I have removed the lemma.

We usually use `Of`, not `From`.
```suggestion
@[simps]
def LaurentSeries.ofForallLtEqZero (f : ℤ → R) (n : ℤ) (hn : ∀(m : ℤ), m < n → f m = 0) :
```
Also,

- there is no `BddBelow` in the assumptions;
- do you plan to have a lemma like "the minimal order of a Laurent series constructed this way is at least `n`"? If no, then it makes sense to move `n` inside `∃ n, ∀ m < n, _` or `f =ᶠ[atBot] 0`.
I changed the def to use `BddBelow`, and added lemmas connecting explicit bounds to the `BddBelow` condition and the order of the resulting series.

Please move it out of the `Set` namespace and call it
```suggestion
theorem BddBelow.wellFoundedOn_lt : BddBelow s → s.WellFoundedOn (· < ·) := by
```
This will allow dot notation.

Also, please add the dual lemma `BddAbove.wellFoundedOn_gt` (you can prove it by `h.dual.wellFoundedOn_lt`).
It was `BddBelow.`, not `BddBelow_`. Otherwise, dot notation won't work.
Oops, sorry about that oversight.  I was wondering why `h.dual.wellFoundedOn_lt` didn't work.
does `:= rfl` work here? Also, this should be tagged with `simp`.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(RingTheory/HahnSeries/Basic): Make a Hahn series from a function with support bounded below

nodes.body:
This work looks good!

All of these results will still hold for Hahn series whose value group has a locally finite order. It would be good to try generalizing to that level to cover multivariate Laurent series also. If that doesn't work for some reason, I am still willing to approve this PR.

I may be mistaken, but I think the value group of multivariate Laurent series like `K((X))((Y))` is a lex product of integers, which is not locally finite.  To construct multivariate Laurent series, perhaps combining the results of this PR with #10781 would be fruitful.

Edit: I think I may have misinterpreted your message.  I will rewrite these results to work with locally finite orders.

Edit 2: I have moved the results to `RingTheory/HahnSeries/Basic.lean`.

Thanks!
bors r+
